main event: A bright, round object appeared to leave a trail, possibly due to extreme speed and brightness, over Albuquerque, New Mexico on May 18, 1958.
interesting points: The object was 15-20 feet in diameter and was observed for 3 seconds.
The object was observed by an experienced Civil Aeronautics Authority airway operations officer with 15 years of experience.
The object was sighted through clouds and appeared to be very bright, coming out of the corners of the dark and deep sky.
The object was observed at a 35-degree angle above the horizon.
The observer noted that the sighting was highly suggestive of a meteor, as seen through adverse sighting conditions.
witnesses: Civil Aeronautics Authority airway operations officer
